titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 108-87.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 32.

action.text: Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 96.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 419 - 0 (Roll no. 164).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 5/8/2003--Passed Senate without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on March 18, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a free public event, the 22nd annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 2003.
